Title:
The first comprehensive report on histoplasmosis in
Indonesia
Keywords:
Indonesia, Histoplasma, demography, risk factors,
phylogeny
Abstract:
Cases of histoplasmosis were reported from Indonesia. No
isolates of Histoplasma capsulatum from Indonesia have been studied. In
this study, we reported histoplasmosis cases collected from certain
databases, personal communication with doctors and medical records from
the Department of Parasitology, Universitas Indonesia. Demographic data,
risk factor, source of infection, clinical presentation, laboratory
data, the clinical outcome were discussed. In addition, molecular
identification and phylogenetic study were conducted to available
isolates in the Department of Parasitology, Universitas Indonesia. We
found 65 clinical cases reported from Indonesia, 64 disseminated and one
acute pulmonary histoplasmosis. Exposure to birds and/or bats was a
common risk factor. Most cases were immunocompromised (some with AIDS)
but others were apparently immunocompetent. Of the 13 isolates studied
phylogenetically, 12 were clustered separately from all other previously
described clades, both by ITS and 4 other protein-coding genes: Arf,
Ole, H-anti, and aTub. These data are indicative of Indonesia probably
being endemic of H. capsulatum.
